group.name: Arithmetic and Logic
group.insn: Immediate is sign extended
Immediate is sign extended
Immediate is not sign extended
Immediate is not sign extended
Immediate is not sign extended
No exception thrown upon overflow
No exception thrown.
The operand is shifted right by imm bits. The most significant bit is filled with 0.
The operand is shifted right by imm bits. The most significant bit is replicated.
The operand is shifted right by op2 bits. The most significant bit is filled with 0.
The operand is shifted right by op2 bits. The most significant bit is replicated.

insn.purpose: lo <- reg0 / reg1; hi <- reminder of reg0 / reg1
lo <- reg0 / reg1; hi <- reminder of reg0 / reg1

group.insn: op1 and op2 are interpreted as unsigned integers.

insn.purpose: lo <- lower_32_bit(reg0 * reg1); hi <- higher_32_bit(reg0 * reg1)
lo <- lower_32_bit(reg0 * reg1); hi <- higher_32_bit(reg0 * reg1)

group.insn: op1 and op2 are interpreted as unsigned integers.

group.name: Constant-Manipulation
group.insn: Load a 32-bit constant into register dst. This might generate multiple machine instructions.
Load address of a label into register dst. This might generate multiple machine instructions.

group.name: Comparison

insn.purpose: reg0 <- if reg1 < reg2 then 1 else 0
reg0 <- if reg1 < imm then 1 else 0
dst < if reg1 < reg2 then 1 else 0

group.insn: op1 and op2 are interpreted as unsigned numbers.

insn.short: set if less than immediate (unsigned comparison)
insn.purpose: dst <- if reg1 < imm then 1 else 0

group.insn: op1 and imm are interpreted as unsigned numbers

group.name: Branching and Jumping

insn.purpose: if reg0 == reg1 then pc <- pc + offset
if reg0 != reg1 then pc <- pc + offset

insn.short: branch if greater or equal to 0
insn.purpose: if reg0 >= 0 then pc <- pc + offset
if reg0 > 0 then pc <- pc + offset

insn.short: branch if less or equal to 0
insn.purpose: if reg0 <= 0 then pc <- pc + offset
if reg0 < 0 then pc <- pc + offset

insn.short: jump to address in register and link

group.insn: Indirect procedure call. If no destination register is given, $ra is used.

group.name: Exceptions, Interrupts and Traps
group.insn: Register $v0 contains the number of the system call.

group.name: Memory Loads and Stores

insn.purpose: reg0 <- load 4 bytes from base + offset

group.insn: Address needs to be aligned to 4 bytes

insn.purpose: reg0 <- load 2 bytes from base + offset and sign extend

group.insn: Address needs to be aligned to 2 Bytes

insn.purpose: reg0 <- load 1 byte from base + offset and sign extend
reg0 <- load 2 bytes from base + offset and do not sign extend

group.insn: Address needs to be aligned to 2 Bytes

insn.purpose: reg0 <- load 1 byte from base + offset and do not sign extend

group.insn: Address needs to be 4 Byte aligned

insn.purpose: store lower halfword of reg0 in register to memory

group.insn: Address needs to be 2 Byte aligned

insn.purpose: store byte in reg0 to memory
